column4: October world factory activity expands slowly  stimulus still needed
column5: LONDON/SYDNEY/NEW YORK Global manufacturing activity increased last month at the same modest pace as in September  suggesting the need for continued economic policy stimulus  especially in Europe.JPMorgan's Global Manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index  produced with Markit  held steady at 52.2 in October. But it was one of the lowest readings this year  suggesting factory activity is expanding slowly.

column4: Turkey's Yildiz Holding says buys United Biscuits
